Recipe.title: Easy Enchiladas
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of Janey Nelson
Recipe.Description:
Real enchiladas require a lot of effort. There is preparing filling, sauce, etc. Then there is a bunch of assembly required.
This recipe isn't really enchiladas, but it will fool just about anybody except a Mexican.

section.instruction: Pour a few Tablespoons of Enchilada Sauce in the bottom of a 9&inch; &by; 9&inch; pan and spread it evenly.
Lay out the burritos evenly across the pan so that they are touching.
Pour the rest of the Enchilada Sauce evenly over the top of the burritos.
Grate the Cheese and spread evenly over the top.

Notes.note: Cheap frozen burritos work great for this recipe. I always buy the cheap family packs that have about a dozen burritos.
If the burritos are small, you may need to use more to get them to touch all the way across.
It is no problem to have the burritos lean against each other, but it can increase the cooking time. For example, 8 burritos in an 8&inch; &by; 8&inch; pan can take a full hour to cook.
